io.codecastle.scriptorium.json.scribe

Class FastJsonScribe

  • Object
    • FastJsonScribe
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FluentAppendable<JsonScribe>, JsonScribe, Closeable, Appendable, AutoCloseable

    public final class FastJsonScribe
extends Object
implements JsonScribe
    A JsonScribe that produces invalid or unexpected output and throws unchecked exceptions rather than checking for misuse of stack semantics.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FastJsonScribe(JsonAppender appender)

    • Method Detail

      • emptyObject

        public JsonScribe emptyObject()
                       throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonScribe
        Outputs an empty JSON object, preceded by a comma if necessary, and returns this object.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the array state, or when in the object state immediately following a key. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Specified by:
        emptyObject in interface JsonScribe
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        JsonScribe.pushObject()

      • pushObject

        public JsonScribe pushObject()
                      throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonScribe
        Outputs the opening brace of a JSON object, preceded by a comma if necessary, and returns this object.

        After a call to this method, a call to JsonScribe.pop() will output the closing brace of the object and return the scribe to its previous state.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the array state, or when in the object state immediately following a key. A JSON object document may be formed by calling this method on a new scribe. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Specified by:
        pushObject in interface JsonScribe
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • key

        public JsonScribe key(CharSequence key)
               throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonScribe
        Outputs a JSON key containing the contents of the provided key, preceded by a comma if necessary, and returns this object.

        The contents of the provided key will be quoted and escaped, and followed by a colon.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the object state. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Specified by:
        key in interface JsonScribe
        Parameters:
        key - the key to append. The contents will be quoted and escaped, and followed by a colon.
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • pushKey

        public JsonScribe pushKey()
                   throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonScribe
        Outputs the opening quotation mark of a JSON key, preceded by a comma if necessary, and returns this object.

        After a call to this method, a call to JsonScribe.pop() will output the closing quotation mark of the key followed by a colon, and return the scribe to its previous state.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the object state. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Specified by:
        pushKey in interface JsonScribe
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the array state, or when in the object state immediately following a key. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

      • pushArray

        public JsonScribe pushArray()
                     throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonScribe
        Outputs the opening bracket of a JSON array, preceded by a comma if necessary, and returns this object.

        After a call to this method, a call to JsonScribe.pop() will output the closing bracket of the array and return the scribe to its previous state.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the array state, or when in the object state immediately following a key. A JSON array fragment may be formed by calling this method on a new scribe. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Specified by:
        pushArray in interface JsonScribe
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • value

        public JsonScribe value(CharSequence value)
                 throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonScribe
        Outputs a string literal containing the contents of the provided value, preceded by a comma if necessary, and returns this object.

        The contents of the provided value will be quoted and escaped.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the array state, or when in the object state immediately following a key. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Specified by:
        value in interface JsonScribe
        Parameters:
        value - the value to append. The contents will be quoted and escaped.
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • value

        public JsonScribe value(float value)
                 throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonScribe
        Outputs a numeric literal, preceded by a comma if necessary, and returns this object.

        If the provided value is not finite, a null literal will be appended instead.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the array state, or when in the object state immediately following a key. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Specified by:

      • pushValue

        public JsonScribe pushValue()
                     throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonScribe
        Outputs the opening quotation mark of a JSON string literal, preceded by a comma if necessary, and returns this object.

        After a call to this method, a call to JsonScribe.pop() will output the closing quotation mark of the string and return the scribe to its previous state.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called when in the array state, or when in the object state immediately following a key. Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Specified by:
        pushValue in interface JsonScribe
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • pop

        public JsonScribe pop()
               throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonScribe
        Returns to the previous scribe state and returns this object.

        When the scribe is in the array state, a call to this method outputs a closing bracket.

        When the scribe is in the object state, a call to this method outputs a closing brace.

        When the scribe is in the value state, a call to this method outputs a quotation mark.

        When the scribe is in the key state, a call to this method outputs a quotation mark followed by a colon.

        If this method is called without being preceded by a corresponding call to a push*() method, implementations may throw an IllegalStateException

        Specified by:
        pop in interface JsonScribe
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • append

        public JsonScribe append(CharSequence sequence)
                  throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonScribe
        Outputs the provided sequence as a JSON string and returns this object.

        The contents of the sequence will be escaped.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called after a call to JsonScribe.pushValue() or JsonScribe.pushKey(). Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Specified by:
        append in interface FluentAppendable<JsonScribe>
        Specified by:
        append in interface JsonScribe
        Specified by:
        append in interface Appendable
        Parameters:
        sequence - the sequence to append. The contents of the sequence will be escaped.
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        JsonScribe.append(CharSequence, int, int), JsonScribe.append(char), Appendable.append(CharSequence)

      • append

        public JsonScribe append(CharSequence sequence,
                         int start,
                         int end)
                  throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonScribe
        Outputs the provided sequence as a JSON string and returns this object.

        The contents of the sequence will be escaped.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called after a call to JsonScribe.pushValue() or JsonScribe.pushKey(). Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Specified by:
        append in interface FluentAppendable<JsonScribe>
        Specified by:
        append in interface JsonScribe
        Specified by:
        append in interface Appendable
        Parameters:
        sequence - the sequence to append. The contents of the sequence will be escaped.
        start - the index of the first character of the sequence to append
        end - the first index after the last character of the sequence to append
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        JsonScribe.append(CharSequence), JsonScribe.append(char), Appendable.append(CharSequence, int, int)

      • append

        public JsonScribe append(char character)
                  throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonScribe
        Outputs the provided character as a JSON string and returns this object.

        The character will be escaped.

        To produce a well-formed JSON document, this method should only be called after a call to JsonScribe.pushValue() or JsonScribe.pushKey(). Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called at another time.

        Specified by:
        append in interface FluentAppendable<JsonScribe>
        Specified by:
        append in interface JsonScribe
        Specified by:
        append in interface Appendable
        Parameters:
        character - the character to append. The character will be escaped.
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        JsonScribe.append(CharSequence), JsonScribe.append(CharSequence, int, int), Appendable.append(char)

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonScribe
        Returns the scribe to its initial state.

        Characters will be output as though JsonScribe.pop() were called in succession until the initial state was reached.

        Specified by:
        close in interface JsonScribe
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • getCursor

        public int getCursor()
        Description copied from interface: JsonScribe
        Returns a cursor representing the current state of the scribe.
        Specified by:
        getCursor in interface JsonScribe
        Returns:
        a cursor
        See Also:
        JsonScribe.pop(int)

      • pop

        public JsonScribe pop(int cursor)
               throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: JsonScribe
        Returns the scribe to the state represented by the cursor and returns this object.

        Characters will be output as though JsonScribe.pop() were called in succession until the desired state was reached.

        Implementations may throw IllegalStateException if the provided cursor represents an invalid state, or a state that has already been popped.

        Specified by:
        pop in interface JsonScribe
        Parameters:
        cursor - a cursor previously returned by JsonScribe.getCursor()
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        JsonScribe.getCursor(), JsonScribe.pop(), JsonScribe.close()

      • pushInscription

        public JsonScribe pushInscription(FluentNode<?> inscription)
        Description copied from interface: JsonScribe
        Registers an inscription node that will be closed the next time this scribe's JsonScribe.pop(), JsonScribe.pop(int), or JsonScribe.close() methods are called.

        Implementations may throw an IllegalStateException if this method is called twice with different arguments between calls to the above-named methods.

        Specified by:
        pushInscription in interface JsonScribe
        Parameters:
        inscription - the inscription node to register to be closed
